str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Breadth. From platus; width.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To encircle, besiege, surround. From the same as kukloi; to encircle, i.e. Surround.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of para and emballo; a throwing in beside, i.e., battle-array, encampment or barracks.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
And, even, also, namely.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To eat up, eat till it is finished, devour, squander, annoy, injure. From kata and esthio; to eat down, i.e. Devour.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
